**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" />Interact ([emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92), [light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163))   **Requirements** The last action you took this turn was to Cast a Spell from the wand; **Effect** You make yourself the center of attention. An illusory spotlight shines [bright light](/Rules.aspx?ID=407) upon your space as you pull inane objects from the wand's tip, such as confetti, silk flowers, streamers, or a long string of colorful kerchiefs knotted end to end. Each enemy within 30 feet must attempt a Will save against your spell DC, receiving a +4 circumstance bonus to the save if you or any of your allies recently threatened it or used [hostile actions](/Rules.aspx?ID=300) against it. On a failure, the creature becomes [fascinated](/Conditions.aspx?ID=14) with you until the end of your next turn. The fascination ends if the target is subject to a hostile act, or if another creature succeeds at a [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) or [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) check against it.

 The spotlight follows you wherever you move. You can't be [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) while in the spotlight. The effect ends if you become [invisible](/Conditions.aspx?ID=26), attempt a [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) check, or Dismiss the activation.

 You can Sustain this Activation for up to 1 minute. Since you need to keep performing tricks, Sustain an Activation has the [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104) trait. Sustaining extends the spotlight, and keeps fascinated creatures fascinated, but doesn't cause creatures not already fascinated to become fascinated.
